events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car on the highway resulting in moderate damage.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a car collision reported by the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle the auto accident claim and guide the customer through the process.
Customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is now being processed.
Request sent to customer asking for police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed.
Customer successfully submitted all requested documents including police report and vehicle damage photos.
Investigation into the auto accident claim has begun to verify details and assess liability for the collision.
Investigation concluded confirming customer was not at fault and vehicle damages are covered under policy.
An initial settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs and related expenses from the accident.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and noted responsiveness of their insurance agent.
The claim was officially approved following the customer’s acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment to cover vehicle repairs was issued promptly to the customer’s designated account.
The auto accident claim has been closed successfully after full payment and repair expense reimbursement.
All documents and case details were archived for record keeping and future reference.
